conversations.content: ...There.
A stag! And a large one. He'd fill the Halidom's larder nicely.
What do you think, Sarisse? Can you take him down with the manacaster from here?
On it!
(Deep breath... Focus. Steady arm... Take aim, and...)
Fi—
Huh? I hadn't even pulled the trigger!
That looked like...an arrow? Who shot it?
What are you two doing in these woods?
Oh! Are...you the one who shot that deer?
I am. A pair of fellow hunters, I take it? Odd choice of weapon for a sylvan, though.
Ah! So you noticed. Here's the thing...
Huh. Thought you'd take the manacaster you got off that human for a whirl and add to your meat stores in one fell swoop, eh?
That was the idea. But I'm so sorry— I didn't realize these were your village's hunting grounds.
Bah, it's fine. I trust our kind to hunt responsibly. But that caster's gotta go.
Why's that?
It's made of steel, for one. You have any idea how many mountains humans have torn apart to mine the ore for those things?
Twists my guts to see a sylvan heftin' one around. Have you no respect for the land you stand on, girl?
What?! Of course I do! It's true that humans may have harmed the earth to mass-produce these in the distant past...
But my friends would never do that. They didn't make this manacaster; they just dug it up and repaired it.
Even so, that doesn't change the fact that Mother Nature paid the price for the birth of that weapon.
I...suppose it doesn't. But I'm sincere when I say that I am very seriously committed to ecological conservation.
At the same time, I swore I'd fight to protect my friends, my family, and the people of my village.
You talk of fighting. Fitting enough you carry an implement of war, then.
Unlike the bow, that thing doesn't require a lick of training. It's all too eager to steal lives for you. An evil invention...
Evil? Surely a tool should be judged by the person who wields it.
One pull of the trigger and a life is snuffed out. I'd say that's proof enough of the evil in the hearts of humans.
Sir, that isn't fair! I agree that it was wrong to level mountains to mine the steel, but that's no basis for calling all humans evil!
...You're still young. I'm sure the humans who've sweet-talked you did a fine job of it, but I'd ask you to think long and hard.
It'll be dark soon. You two are welcome to stay the night in our village. You're family.
*sigh* Seems like there's still a big divide between sylvans and humankind.
I'm afraid so. He's hardly the only sylvan I've met with closed-minded views about other races.
And I get it. That's how they were raised. How they've lived their whole lives. Still!
Manacasters are a perfectly respectable part of human culture, no different from our preservation of nature.
I hate it when people dig in their heels and refuse to consider other perspectives.
And I just know that if they'd reach across that divide and actually get to know the other side, they'd change their minds!
I hope so, Sarisse... Now, it's getting late. Let's get some sleep. It's back to bow hunting tomorrow, right?
Right. We have to respect these people's rules while we're here. Good night, Melsa.
Night, Sarisse.
Mnnngh...AHHH! I slept well! Ready to hit the hunting trail?
Yep! I'd like to thank the man from yesterday for his hospitali... Huh?
That's a big crowd. I wonder what's up.
Maybe something happened. Let's go take a look!
Sorry to butt in, but is everything all right?
Hm? Oh, it's you girls. A bear came through last night and tore up our fields.
Does that happen often?
Aye. The forest here's bountiful, but it can't compete with the village food stores.
We see bears, boars, deer... All sorts of animals come to eat our crops.
That must be difficult... Plus there's the danger of a villager being attacked.
It's a real problem. Which is why we cull any animals who make a habit of raiding the village.
Much as we hate to harm a part of nature, it has to be done.
I see. So you've already taken care of that bear?
No... We couldn't finish it off before it ran. It's a big one, to boot.
Won't it be back, then? Bears are notoriously persistent when it comes to food.
Aye. That's why we're setting out to hunt it before that happens.
I'll come with you, then!
I thought I told you plain that we don't want anyone shooting a manacaster in our woods.
I understand that. I brought my bow as well. Please, let me help you.
Hm... If you're using a bow, I've no cause to turn you down. Follow me and stay alert.
Can do!
There it is, mister! Looks like it didn't wander far.
Waiting for a chance to sneak back into the village, the cheeky devil... All right. This time, we'll—
Grrr?
Damn, it spotted us!
Rrrrr... GROAR!
No, it's running...towards the village!
After it!
Sarisse? You coming?
Yeah, just... That bear's awfully high- strung. It's got freakishly good hearing, too.
Hm? True... We were barely whispering, but it heard us from that distance.
Bears do have sharp ears, but that one's on a whole different—wait a second.
Sharp ears... Aha! That's perfect!
Um... Hellooo? Sarisse?
Get this, Melsa: I just thought of a way to get rid of that bear without having to kill it!
Now, to put this genius plan into action!
Sar—ack! Sarisse, where are you going?!
Hurry! We've gotta beat it back to the village!
Looks like we made it back to the village ahead of the bear. Now I just need my manacaster!
*gasp* *wheeze* But I thought we weren't supposed to use that here!
We're not, but... Oh, I'll explain later! We just need it right now!
Need it for WHAT, though, Sarisse?
BEAR! It's headed for the village!
Here it comes. I'll explain everything once this is over. Now c'mon, Melsa!
Rrr... Hrrrgh...!
Wait! Please, stay away from the village!
Grrrrr... GROAR!
No! It's coming straight for us!
Get down, mister!
Wha—?!
GRARGH?!
That give you a scare? Have another taste!
GRAH?! *whimper* Nroooarh...
Phew.
The sound of the shots scared him away...
You attacked the bear with that...that thing! How could you?! Using that man-made monstrosity to murder a part of nature...!
I apologize for using the manacaster against your wishes, but you were trying to avoid harming the bear, weren't you?
Well, this manacaster made that possible, so I made the call to use it.
You did that...for me?
Yeah. That bear has unusually keen ears, right? So I realized a loud enough noise would convince it this place wasn't safe.
That may be true, but...! I mean, yes, there's nothing here we use in our daily lives that's that loud...
Right. Which is why some animals have never learned to steer clear of your home.
Because they didn't fear it...
So by making a sound that doesn't exist in nature, you taught them that this is a scary place they should stay away from.
Exactly. So you should see fewer animals coming into your village from here on. I AM sorry for breaking my promise, though.
But it was to help protect the animals you guys care so deeply for. To protect nature.
Using a human war-machine not to sully the land, but to spare it...
Yes! A manacaster can just as easily save a bear's life as end it. You understand how animals behave. Am I wrong here?
No, I... I suppose not. Our sylvan ways wouldn't have saved that bear.
We owe it all to you...and that caster.
Thank you for understanding.
Perhaps...I've been a bit too wary of humans and their ways.
Sarisse, was it? It would please me if you'd come by our woods now and again to hunt. If you'd like, that is.
Hearing those shots may help the animals understand the bounds between our land and theirs better. Keep them safe.
It'd be my pleasure! I'll hunt here with the utmost respect, to help preserve this beautiful forest.
Phew...
*whistles* Somebody's on fire today.
She was always a deft hand with the bow, but she has a real talent with that manacaster as well.
Hey, Euden. Luca. What brings you two to the practice range?
I caught wind of a rumor about a certain sylvan village with bear trouble and the plucky hero who saved the day.
Oh, that? Heh heh. What can I say? Guilty as charged. I was pretty proud of that one!
Well, consider me proud of you, too. That village was always a bit leery of us humans.
But they've warmed up to talks with us over the last few days.
Using human technology to preserve the sylvan way of life... Quite brilliant, really.
Ha ha, I'm glad you're so impressed! That whole incident made me realize something important, too.
Oh yeah?
Yeah! How important it is to understand other people, places, and cultures!
I want to be the chief of my own village someday. That's why I need to get busy learning about the outside world now.
The way I figure it, the more I learn now, the better a leader I can be then!
Wise words. And I believe I have just the opportunity for you to put them to practice. Don't you think, Luca?
Ugh, you're really gonna send me up north with this gremlin in tow?
What's this about? Dish.
I'd like to ask a favor of you, Sarisse. You know that we're beginning to have more dealings in North Grastaea lately, yes?
I've been thinking of sending Luca on a scouting mission to have a look at one of their cities.
I was hoping I could persuade you to accompany him.
Whaaat?! North Grastaea? I've never been! Sign me up!
Flash forward to you whining about the cold and throwing a tantrum about wanting to come home. Look, just—
GRNFH!
I'm not a CHILD, Luca! This is a wonderful opportunity to learn about another culture. Of COURSE I'm on board.
Ha ha! I'm glad to hear it. I'll leave the matter to you two, then. Noelle will serve as your guide.
Ugh... Fine. Guess I can't complain about what's basically a vacation. Just don't go getting lost on me, gremlin.
Obviously! Ooh, I'm so excited... I'm gonna study the HECK outta this place!
Ah... Ahhh... AH-CHOO!
(Eep!) A-are you, um... Are you okay? Our next observation site isn't much farther, so, um... Yeah.
*sniff* Thanks, Noelle. It's so cold up here, I think I'm already coming down with something... WAH-CHOO!
This? This right here? This is why I told you not to come. C'mon, let's pick up the pace before you freeze into a Sarisse-sicle.
Wow... So this is a human city on the northern continent!
Er, yes. Mora. Th-that's its name, I mean. They're one of Svenitla's trading partners.
It's prosperous by Northern standards, but that also makes it a frequent target for its jealous neighbors. So, um...
(Where're they from?) (How should I know?) (Never seen garb like that before.)
*fidget* Urgh... As you can see, they're not the biggest fans of outsiders around here.
My country, Svenitla, has struggled to forge a lasting connection here as well.
Gotcha. But if they're that well-off, it's in our interest to figure out a way of making friends here.
The question is how. Got any bright ideas, Sar—
...Huh? Where's Sarisse?!
Oh gosh! You're right! Sh-she's not here... Do you, um... Do you think she got lost?
Ugh, it never ends with her!  C'mon, let's go find her, Noelle.
...Here. One dried fermented fish.
Thank you much! Y'know, I hear this is a local delicacy.
Hmph. Just do us both a favor and leave it in the bag. I don't need some gawky tourist hurling her guts out after one whiff.
Whoaaa, is it really that pungent?
Enough to send every tourist I ever met running. Fools can't appreciate the subtlety of Moran cuisine.
Gosh. When you talk it up like that, it just makes me even more curious to try it! Here we go. Baaag... OPEN!
Gah! *cough* Ugh, it smells like Luca's socks after a full day of target practice!
See? That's why we all tell you people to leave well enough alone.
Look, I'll let you return it. Just gimme the bag, girl.
Hey now! The smell may be a little... okay, a LOT bad, but I still haven't tasted it.
So down the hatch it goes! *NOMF* ...Mm? Mmmmmm?!
Yeah, yeah. You hate it. No accounting for taste with you outsiders. Just don't gag on me. I'm not looking to mop the—
Stars above and earth below... This. Is. AMAZING!!!
...Huh?
I've never had anything like it! It's salty, it's sour, it's all over the place!
I'm going back for another bite! *HOMF*
Whoa, ease up. If you wolf it down like that, the smell'll wreck your nose.
Aaaah, it stings! Sinuses...burning!
*sigh* I tried to warn ya.
I couldn't help myself! And the weird thing is, I kinda...like how it feels? *CHOMP* Ha ha, it smells SO BAD! But it's so good!
...Heh. You're a funny one, kid.
*huff* *pant* Dang it, Sarisse. Where the heck did you run off to this time?
L-Luca! Over there!
What's with the crowd? Sounds like they're having a party.
Not bad, girly! Here, have another round, on me.
I've never eaten crushed ice before! It's so cold, I... Oh... Oh no... BRAIN FREEZE! Owww...
Noelle. Please tell me why my sister is sitting under a snow dome eating ice with the locals.
Th-that's, um...a local tradition here. The people of Mora do that to, er... To ward off bad luck.
But as for why Sarisse is blending right in with them, uh... I really don't, er...
Ah! Luca! Noelle! Check this snow dome out!
It looks super cold, but it's actually surprisingly warm inside.
Uh... Neat? But wait, weren't you getting sick from the cold just a minute ago?
Hm? Was I? Now that you mention it, I do vaguely...remember...
...that...
Sarisse?!
*sigh* What kind of genius comes to the frozen North and eats a giant bowl of ice?
Aha ha ha... Oh, b-but she's awake now, and her, um... Her fever's broken.
That's good, at least. Once she's back on her feet, we can move on to the next spot. Hey, Sarisse? Big bro's coming in.
Aha ha ha! Look, you guys! Isn't this embroidery cute?
Wow, you're so good at that, Sarisse. And I've never seen knitting like that before!
Isn't it neat? That's how we do it back in the village where I grew up.
It's an extra-tight weave, so I bet you could use it in your windows to block the snow and wind.
Hey, that's not a bad idea. We don't have enough glass to set in every window, so this'll be a big help.
And if you used sheep's wool, I bet it'd make a nice, warm rug!
Ha ha ha ha haaa!
She really didn't waste any time making friends here in Mora, did she?
It's...r-really impressive.  I could never pull that off.
Don't beat yourself up. She's just freakish that way. Always has been.
Still... Being able to laugh with people as notoriously gruff as the Morans is honestly very impressive!
Can't argue with that. I'm an affable guy, sure, but Sarisse is, like...magnetic.
She's a weird little dork of a sister, but I guess she IS pretty amazing.
So this is Valzgald... It's huge! And talk about bustling!
Oh, um, yes. Valzgald is one of the North's most active trade centers.
It's said they grew to this scale by becoming a melting pot for all sorts of different cultures and peoples.
Ooh, then we should be able to learn all SORTS of things here!
Let's get to it, yeah? C'mon, you two.
Ah, Sarisse! That way is—!
Huh. This backstreet feels awfully different from the main boulevard.
Th-this is the, um...less affluent part of town. A slum, really, and i-it's not very safe here, so we should really...
A slum? The city's this established, but they still have a poverty problem?
Yes. It's true that Valzgald developed by taking in aspects of other cultures that boosted their productivity, but, er...
Quickly jumping to new ways of doing things can mean that old traditions sort of...fall by the wayside.
And as efficiency increases, there's less need for labor, s-so lots of people have found themselves out of work.
Plus, not everyone is capable of keeping up when things change so fast.
Gotcha... I guess being eager to adopt other cultures has its challenges. ...Hm?
What's up, Sis?
Oh, I was just looking at that stall.
A silversmith? No...a rokkan steelworker?!
Wooow, these are all so awesome! Did you make all these here, mister?
I got no time for window shoppers. Move along.
Huh? I wasn't trying to be a nuisance...
Yeah right, sylvan. As if you steel haters can see the value in quality metalcraft.
Hey now! That's not fair of you to say.
I meant it when I said these accessories look amazing, so please don't be like that!
Oh, be still my heart. I'm blushing already. Now, why don't you turn your little cottontail around and go home, bunny?
Okay, THAT does it. You wanna see me get serious? 'Cause I'm about to get serious over here!
Now stop being a big jerk and teach me how to make these things!
Whaaaaat?!
Wh-what are you on about? You're tourists, ain't ya?
I can stay here awhile! RIGHT, Noelle?
Huh?! Er, uhhh, y-yes! Our itinerary has us staying here for, um... For five days?
See? Plenty of time! I'm not a tourist, by the way—I'm here to study other cultures.
And I'll have you know I'm a very quick learner, so teach me some rokkan tech!
Hah... We'll see about that.
Fine. I'll be REAL curious to see if a wimpy little sylvan girl's up to the task.
*gasp* *pant* I... I didn't think I'd be mining my own ore!
Giving up already, cottontail?
Rrgh! I'm FINE, thankyouverymuch! I'll dig clear through the mountain if I have to!
See, you gotta work it into shape while it's still red-hot. It'll send up sparks, but you're just gonna have to tough it out!
Ack! Augh! Hot hot HOT!
*groooan* I've got burns all over, and my whole body is sore...
Hey. I told you to be here before sunrise. A craftsman's day starts early.
I know that! I swear, I'm gonna make an accessory so nice, you'll BEG me to let you sell it at your stall!
Hah. Cute. Now stop giving me lip and march to the workshop.
...Phew. It's done. I think.
Let's have a look. ...Mm.
It's not awful. Still rough around the edges, but it's better than I expected.
Today's your last day, yeah? You took it right down to the wire, but...we'll call it a passing grade.
Really?! Yes... YESSSSS!
Hmph. May as well commemorate the occasion. You made this thing, so take it with you.
Really? I can have it?!
Sure. Call it a memento. It's...the last piece that'll come out of this shop anyhow.
What? What do you mean?
Exactly what it sounds like. I'm going out of business.
You're giving up on your stall?!
Yeah. Writing's been on the wall for a while now. I figured you'd give up and run after a day, tops, so I didn't mention it.
But steelwork is a traditional rokkan craft, isn't it? Why give it up?
It is, and I'm damn proud of it. I'm not giving it up, exactly. It'll just be taking a different shape.
Meaning...?
Here. Have a look.
This is one of your accessories, yeah?
...Wait, no. It's nice enough, but it doesn't have the same flavor as one of yours.
No surprises there. Wasn't made by hand.
It wasn't? Then how was it made?
With another rokkan city's tech. ＂Metal casting,＂ they call it. It's the latest trend to catch on around these parts.
A new trend? ...Ah.
Quickly jumping to new ways of doing things can mean that old traditions sort of...fall by the wayside.
So, people are just going to switch to this new way of steelworking?
Casting's better for mass production. More product means more sales means a richer city. So they told me to ditch the old stuff.
But...don't you feel any attachment to hand-crafting your pieces?
'Course I do. But I gotta eat. I gotta live. So I'm closing up the workshop and starting work at the big factory downtown.
It's a good place, with good people. Just... I'm sad to see the old hand-crafting ways disappear like so much smoke.
That's where you're wrong. They won't.
Huh? How d'you figure, cottontail?
People may be all for casting right now. It's cheap and you can put out a lot of product—and that's all fine and dandy.
But someday they'll realize that handmade pieces have a charm you just can't get anywhere else!
Heck, even I could tell that one apart from your work at a glance. I know yours are way nicer!
People will come back around to wanting your work again, and in droves. So don't you worry about your tradition ending!
Well, shucks, Sarisse...
Heh heh... Just do me a favor and don't ever forget the craft you worked so hard to hone. I promise I won't forget it, either.
Keep teaching your techniques to more people like you taught them to me. That way, you'll know your tradition will live on.
...Heh.
Gah hah hah ha! Yeah... I'd take a decent hand-made piece over a mass-produced piece of junk any day, too!
Soon as the knuckleheads in this town wise up to that, I'll be right back to my workshop.
Till then... You got a deal. I won't forget. And that's a promise.
I'll hold you to it! And I promise you the same.
*yaaawn* Not much left on our scouting trip to-do list, huh? What an adventure, though! I've learned so much.
No kidding. I've learned how exhausting it is traveling with you.
Wh—hey! It's not MY fault all these places have such interesting local customs.
You really seemed to enjoy each stop along the way, Sarisse.
I've also seen more facets of the other cities of the northern continent. It's been fun. So, um... Thank you. So much!
Aw, thank YOU, Noelle! We wouldn't have made it anywhere without you to guide us.
That's my job. So, um... To get back to that for a moment, we should, er... We should really hurry through this area.
Hm? Why's that?
Th-the Lashtern region sees a lot of fighting among the small city-states jockeying for dominance.
Travelers have to watch out for former mercenaries or soldiers from fallen states that have turned to b-banditry.
Wow, okay. So...
That's what the guys following us are up to?
Tch... Guess they're on to us.
Did you really think sylvan ears wouldn't pick up on you stomping around like that?
Feh. I'm mostly thinking there's only three of you.
They're clearly trained fighters. Th-they must be ex-soldiers!
So they were just normal soldiers whose country got taken over? Why attack US, then?
As if you'd understand. An honest man with no country's got no way to live.
But we've still got families. Mouths to feed...
I'll take dishonor before I let them starve... Shame that means you lot have to die instead!
Aaugh!
...Huh? I'm okay. Why am I okay?
Are you unharmed, Miss Sarisse?
Ah! You're...
A dragon? Hey, I know you! You've been to the Halidom a few times, right? Your name was...
AC-011 Garland of Pravda's Air Force, sir. Pleasure to see you again, Master Luca.
G-Garland! Oh, thank you so much!
Pravda? *spit* You're not dragons, you're hyenas. Sticking your noses into other people's wars... Here to finish us off?
No. I saw this altercation happening and intervened to protect Miss Sarisse. But that is not what brings me here.
I come on orders from Pravda Headquarters to speak with you all.
With us? What are you lot scheming?
Pravda is not engaged in any scheming, sir. We wish only to see Lashtern freed from its long history of violence.
And just how do you propose to do that?
The nation responsible for your homeland's destruction is expanding at a rapid rate, absorbing all neighboring lands by force.
We seek an alliance among the remnants of those fallen lands to stop them before war consumes the entire continent.
So... He wants to join up with these guys to help them win a rematch against the people who took their country?
Y-yes. Pravda is an independent group of dragons working to end war through their own methods.
I, um... I believe they've entered the conflict here in Lashtern in hopes of bringing peace to the region.
Then isn't this a huge opportunity for these people? If they win, they could retake their homeland!
...We refuse.
What? Why?!
Lashtern has long been a prosperous land, beloved by dragons... We've lived our whole lives with reverence for their kind.
But not Pravda. Not after you lot violated the rule that true dragons hold fast.
What, the old rule that said dragons shouldn't directly intervene in human conflict?
Yes... North Grastaea is the birthplace of the Ilian Church. Many of the people here still cling to the old ways quite fiercely.
To those people, Pravda abandoning their rule seems like, um... Like someone abandoning their own faith.
Anyone who would spit on something bequeathed to them by their ancestors is no dragon.
Their kind are beasts, and nothing more.
Hey now! Do you really have to put it like that?! I'm sure Garland and his team have their reasons! He's—
Miss Sarisse. If you please...
Why are you stopping me?! I'm not just going to let him badmouth you, Garland!
I fear there is little you or I could say to change his mind.
One cannot expect the ancient traditions of a land to be rewritten overnight. Nor does anyone have the right to do as much.
Well, yeah, but...
Hmph. If you knew that much, why bother coming at all? All you animals know is how to crush the opposition by force.
Okay, THAT is just... AAARGH! I'm done! I am about to LOSE IT with this guy!
GWARGH?!
Wha—?!
Have you lost your mind, woman?!
You take it back! Everything you said about Garland, take it back right now!
Why should I mince words to spare the feelings of a girl from a country in league with Pravda?
Forget Pravda! Forget countries!
Wh... What?
I've seen dozens of people cherishing dozens of different cultures. I learned from them—laughed and cried with them!
What matters most to a person depends on who they are. On their race, on where they were born. That's your right! But...
But anybody who trash-talks another person's beliefs without even TRYING to understand them is wrong. PERIOD!
Miss Sarisse...
Sh-she does have a point... It isn't right to reject others without knowing anything about them.
(*gulp*) U-um...! P-please hear me out, everyone!
The reason Garland cast aside the old rule has n-nothing to do with power or faith. It was a sincere, principled choice.
Principled? THEM?
Y-yes. Garland and the other dragons of Pravda are troubled by the North's long history of war and violence.
Some people may say they only want to rule by force, but...they're just trying to protect their homeland.
As in...North Grastaea?
Miss Noelle... I am both humbled and joyed beyond words by your understanding.
And to you, people of Lashtern... I will not ask for your understanding. Only know that I cannot bear to see this land suffer so.
In times past, it was home to the beautiful river Lena, to the Scarlet Forest and its magnificent pines...
Now the forest stands in ash. Burned, the day our kingdom fell. And now it's the Lena that runs scarlet with my people's blood.
So...you see them, too. The same painful sights.
...Fine. Garland, was it? I rescind my prior comment. You're not a beast.
Really?! I mean, thank you! Ha ha. It turns out you're actually a good guy, mister!
Tch. Drop the friendly act. I didn't say I'd work with them.
No, and that's fine! You took the first step towards understanding, though. And that's a beautiful thing.
Step one is learning about each other's values and beliefs—each other's culture! If you don't make that first effort...
Then you'll never get anywhere!
Ahhh, it's so warm here! I didn't mind the air up North, but I'm definitely a Southern girl at heart.
Miss Sarisse.
Garland! It's been a minute. How are things back in Lashtern? Any progress?
Indeed. We have been in talks with the remnant forces. It seems a formal cooperation agreement is forthcoming.
Really? That's great! I'm so glad they were willing to listen.
Credit for that is entirely yours. I fear I had altogether abandoned hope of swaying them from the old ways.
Aw, c'mon! All I did was give him a left hook to the ribs...
And yet your form was pristine. I have never seen a body blow of its like. Might I inquire after your training regimen?
Ah... Ha ha... Yeaaah, that's just a little habit I picked up from hanging around my idiot brother. It's basically reflex by now.
She really is incredible. Look how friendly she is with Garland already. And I hear she made quite the impact up North.
She probably gave that poor guy a hairline fracture... I feel like that trip aged me by a decade, easy.
But it did get me thinking. The way she throws herself into things headlong's what lets her cross cultural divides so easily.
That naive curiosity'd probably let her make friends just about anywhere in the world.
Ha ha. I don't doubt it for a second. She just may go on to shape the future into something truly remarkable.
Something you or I couldn't even imagine—a world where kindness and naive curiosity quell the fires of conflict before their first embers ever spark to life.
